quest.name: In Search of Hermes
journal: Hythlodaeus is ready to continue on if you are.
Duly disguised and somewhat blending in, you set off with Emet-Selch and Hythlodaeus for the observation hub of Anagnorisis, where you will ask someone to point you in the direction of Hermes.

Upon arriving, you learn that Hermes should be out conducting observations as usual. As the man's focus of late has been aquatic creatures, he is like to be found at one of the pools at the facility, and so you split up to look for him.

Making your way around the picturesque gardens of Anagnorisis, you finally come upon a man who fits Hermes's description. At his side is a peculiar blue-haired girl with avian features, who takes an immediate interest in you. Though she seems to struggle with her words, to your surprise, she can speak fluently and directly to you in your mind, and expresses her desire to be friends. When your companions join you shortly thereafter, Hermes introduces the girl as Meteion, a pet project. Upon learning that Emet-Selch has official matters to discuss, he bids you wait at the main building while he tends to the ambystomas under his care, but notices with a start that one is missing. Apparently, the creature has found its way into the boughs of a tree outside the facility's grounds, and Hermes rushes to its aid with Meteion on his heels. While Emet-Selch and Hythlodaeus watch over its fellows, you are tasked with assisting Hermes.

The ambystoma has been delivered safely to the ground, but in its former place you find Hermes, suspended upside down from a branch. After extricating himself from his predicament, he thanks you for coming to his aid, and bids you welcome to Elpis. And thus, after a long journey through time and space, do you strike up an acquaintance with the man who will become Fandaniel. By learning more about him, you hope that you will find the key to the star's salvation...

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: As dubious as it is, passing you off as Azem's familiar is probably the best approach. Should shehe take offense that others so readily believe herhis recklessness is to blame, shehe is welcome to mend herhis ways.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: ...Pass as a child in your original size? I think not. Augmented or no, your aether is still far too thin to be considered normal.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: If you are ready, let us continue along the path to Anagnorisis.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: The place serves as an observation hub and residence both.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Someone there should be able to point us in the direction of Hermes.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: I was wondering what she was examining, but it seems to be the bush itself...

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Let's see if this observer knows Hermes's whereabouts.

dialogue.name: ANAGNORISISSTAFF04422
dialogue.text: Yes? Can I help you?

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: We wish to speak with Chief Hermes. Do you know where we might find him?

dialogue.name: ANAGNORISISSTAFF04422
dialogue.text: Well, now... By your mask, I assume you are one of the Fourteen. I wasn't aware there was to be a visitation...

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Between you and us, it's something of a surprise. Your discretion in the matter would be appreciated.

dialogue.name: ANAGNORISISSTAFF04422
dialogue.text: I see, I see. My lips are sealed!

dialogue.name: ANAGNORISISSTAFF04422
dialogue.text: The chief should be out conducting observations as usual. His focus of late has been aquatic creatures, so I expect you will find him at one of the pools here.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: The pools, you say? Many thanks, and apologies for disrupting your work.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: I say, Hythlodaeus... While I've never met Hermes, you know him well, do you not?

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: That being the case, couldn't you simply find him by his aether?

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Aye, that I could...

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: As you know, Emet-Selch and I can discern the color of souls.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: By the same token, we can also see aether quite keenly, and from great distances.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: With this skill, I could readily locate Hermes, but I felt that it would be a waste of an opportunity.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: We're here to perform an assessment, after all. By searching the ordinary way, we stand to gain insight into Elpis and the man in charge of it.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: This is as much for your own enjoyment, like as not. But point taken.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: If you're going to accompany us, make yourself useful and help us look for Hermes.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: According to his profile, he has short, dark hair.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: So you know, it's because we're in Elpis that we don't have our cowls up. A special exemption due to the need to be aware of dangerous creatures.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Elsewhere, we do not exhibit our individuality. It's unseemly. This is all common sense, but I would not assume you possess any.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Heh heh! It's a rare treat indeed to be able to search for someone by their appearance, and I thank you for humoring me.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Come, let's find our man!

dialogue.name: ANAGNORISISSTAFF04422
dialogue.text: Still looking for the chief? He should be out observing somewhere, likely at one of the pools.

dialogue.name: METEION
dialogue.text: Heh heh! They have such funny faces!

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: The tenet of the Words of Mitron is to create aquatic life both unique and beneficial. Aquatic.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: What would possess them to put this creature in the sky? And is it even aquatic to begin with...?

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: The ambystoma was submitted to the bureau not long ago, and I'm pleased to see it has found its way here.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: We'll make sure these little ones don't wander off like their adventurous fellow. Go on and lend Hermes a hand.

dialogue.name: METEION
dialogue.text: Hermes! Are you...all right?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: It seems Hermes and Meteion have found their quarry, a creature known in this age as an ambystoma.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Yet though it has been safely extricated from the tree, Hermes appears to have found himself in quite the predicament...

dialogue.name: METEION
dialogue.text: The ambystoma. Hermes saw it high up the tree.

dialogue.name: METEION
dialogue.text: He climbed up to get it. But it jumped on him, and he slipped...

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Do you need a hand?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Everything is under control, I trust?

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: (-Hermes-)<grunt> No, no, I'm fine, if a little embarrassed...

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: (-Hermes-)<grunt> Yes, rest assured this is nothing new to me. I've ended up in far more compromising positions in the course of my work.

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: (-Hermes-)Now, for your own safety, please stand back...

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: Ugh...

dialogue.name: METEION
dialogue.text: Hermes! Are you all right?

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: Quite all right, yes... My apologies for making you worry, Meteion.

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: Both you and...er...

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: Forename Surname, you are called? An intriguing name, somehow reminiscent of a new creation...

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: Thank you for coming after me.

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: As for you, little one, you must be more careful.

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: You may be able to fly, but it doesn't mean you cannot fall and hurt yourself.

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: Oh no, I had forgotten all about its fellows!

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: Truly? What a relief... I must thank Emet-Selch and Hythlodaeus when I return to them. But first, with the distractions out of the way...

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: As chief overseer of Elpis, permit me to welcome you to our facility. I hope you will enjoy your time here.
